curated_text: Symbol: V. Year: 2024. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the UK Competition Appeal Tribunal, CAT, Litigation European Commission Interregional Interchange Investigation, the European Commission, Visa, the European Economic Area, EEA, Mackmin v. Visa Inc., Burke v. Visa Inc., the National ATM Council, Pulse Network Visa, the U.S., District Court, LLC, Independent Sales Organizations, Visa’s, MiCamp Solutions, Apple Inc., Visa Inc., Mastercard Incorporated, Apple, the U.S. District Court, MDL, JPML, U.S. Income Tax Litigation, Company, the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, IRS, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act, SEC, Contents Overview Visa, VisaNet, Diluted, B-1, Pismo Holdings, Pismo, Legal Matters, Europe Retrospective Responsibility, Table of Contents, the Visa Foundation, Interlink, U.S. International Visa, U.S. International, 33 Table of Contents, International Visa International Visa, Contents • Personnel, • Interest, Capital Resources Cash Flow Data, 37 Table of Contents Uses of Liquidity, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, FASB, Accounting Standards Update, ASU, Issuer Purchases, Shares Purchased, Mine Safety Disclosures. Context excerpt: competition in violation of UK antitrust law. In the class action claims filed before the UK Competition Appeal Tribunal (CAT), a class certification rehearing took place in April 2024. In June 2024, the CAT granted class certification in the claim regarding interchange fees on commercial credit cards. Other Litigation European Commission Interregional Interchange Investigation On July 5, 2024, the European Commission acknowledged a public undertaking from Visa that will extend the interregional interchange rate limits agreed in April 2019 for an additional five years, until November 1, 2029. The rate limits apply to consumer debit and credit cards issued outside the European Economic Area (EEA), when used at merchants located within the EEA. U.S. ATM Access Fee Litigation On May 2, 2024, in the consumer class action naming Visa, Mastercard and three financial institutions as defendants, Mackmin v. Visa Inc., et al., Visa and Mastercard entered a definitive class settlement agreement w
